Tweet: The most powerful goal so far at #Qatar2022? Luis Chávez's strike against @SaudiNT for @miseleccionmx 💥  The Al Rihla, @adidas' official ball for the #FIFAWorldCup, contains technology to help track data at the tournament.  Find out more:

🏆 2022 WORLD CUP: Quarterfinals  The last time Morocco 🇲🇦 qualified to reach the knockout stage was in Mexico World Cup in 1986  when they lost to Germany 1-0.  In #Qatar2022, they are the only African team currently qualified for the Quarter Finals stage.  https://t.co/QkCMtpVWKC

I Just landed in Mexico City from Oslo the airport is full of people back from #Qatar2022 … seeing Arabic on shirts, Hats and bags feels so comforting as opposed to 2, 3 years ago where you can get dirty looks and even questioned for wearing a something with Arabic on it
#WhereAreYouReally I’m in South Texas and can smell Mexico from here. Brazil will win the #WorldCup2022  https://t.co/lfLyGIsARR
